page.title: 12THE NEW VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The new{village hall}was designed and built by members of the new community of Apperley. It is situated by the playing fields where there is a football, tennis and netball area. The village hall was finished on 14th February 1985, financed by the sale of the land of the old village hall for Â£52,500 for{residential {development.}Local men were the architect and builder. A fund was set up to raise the balance for the building of the hall; large companies such as Dowty & Rank Xerox also donated money. The total cost of the hall was Â£67,O5O. The hall consists of nine rooms, including a toilet with facilities for the disabled,a kitchen and the main hall. Criticisms have been made about its peripheral position & lack of stage facilities.
